thread.title_full: California Officer Injured on Job Loses Bid for Higher Leave Pay

author: Mike Vilensky
title: California Officer Injured on Job Loses Bid for Higher Leave Pay
text:
A California corrections officer entitled to an increase in workers’ compensation after an attack by inmates can’t apply the increase to enhanced benefits for public employees, California’s top court said Thursday.
The ruling from California’s Supreme Court affirmed a lower court decision that Michael Ayala’s recoverable compensation applies to workers’ compensation disability payments and not the more generous “industrial disability leave payments” for public employees.
Ayala was injured while working for the Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation. Under California’s workers’ compensation law, an employee injured because of his employer’s willful misconduct gets a 50% increase in recoverable compensation.
